A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
This movie was far better than Episode 7\, though that is a low bar to hurtle\, The Last Jedi does so gracefully.

New character archetypes\, and character failures bring a refreshing realism to this world. "Fewer" Deus Ex plot points\, and failed missions bring a truer sense of war. Allying enemies break down stereotypes and ideological barriers for brief moments\, revealing differing "points of views" (though this should have been done to more effect).

I'm glad to see The Last Jedi not commit as many sins as The Force Awakens\, but it does not fulfill on the promises & mystery The Force Awakens sowed. I blame that on The Force Awakens more than The Last Jedi. 

This movie does a great job of setting up the possibility of a unique and interesting sequel.

Pros: 
Characters drive this story.
Heroes don't always win because they want to. 
Choices have consequences. 

Cons:
Characters don't change.
Unexpected things happen for gags. 
Some of the humor was jarring and made me feel like I was watching a marvel movie. Too much wink and nod to the audience. The typical cheap/quick joke to make you laugh the first time\, and sigh the second time. Jokes that undercut the dire situations\, and over acted impressions of Hitler.
Poor character decisions that could easily be cleared up by having real human conversations.
